thread.title: Sideline: Hillis Grand Marshal of LR parade; Greenbrier volleyball
thread.title_full: Sideline: Hillis Grand Marshal of LR parade; Greenbrier volleyball

author: Staff
title: Sideline: Hillis Grand Marshal of LR parade; Greenbrier volleyball
text:
Sideline: Hillis Grand Marshal of LR parade; Greenbrier volleyball Posted: October 22, 2015 - 6:45pm Hillis Grand Marshal of Christmas parade in LR 
LITTLE ROCK — Former Conway, Razorback and NFL star Peyton HIlls will be the Grand Marshal of the 27th Big Jingle Jubilee Holiday Parade in Little Rock on Saturday, Dec. 5. 
Hillis was a running back for the Wampus Cats before playing four years at the University of Arkansas. Following his senior season at Arkansas, he was drafted in the seventh round of the 2008 NFL Draft by the Denver Broncos. 
He played six seasons with the Broncos, Cleveland Browns and New York Giants and was a Madden cover boy, Hillis retired from football earlier this year after multiple concussions. He and his family reside in northwes Arkansas, where he is a volunteer coach for the Siloam Springs Panthers. Beginning at Second and Broadway in Little Rock, the parade will start at 3 p.m. and travel south on Broadway, turn west onto Capitol Avenue and end at the State Capitol. 
A lighting and fireworks display will follow at dark or approximately 6 p.m. Both events are free and open to the public. 
Hillis will join Santa, Rudy the Reindeer and many more of theirLegendary friends for this year’s highly anticipated holiday parade. Greenbrier prevails against Morrilton 
Greenbrier’s volleyball team defeated Morrilton on Tuesday, 25-18, 25-13, 22-25, 25-15, in its final regular-season match. 
Harlie Langston had 12 kills and Katherine Jeane 11 as the Lady Panthers finished fourth in 5A-West at 8-6. Jaylee Engelkes had five blocks and six kills. Raven Gray had five kills and Kobie Hartman 22 assists. 
Morrilton won the JV match, 25-19, 25-18. Audie Finley had four digs and was a defensive standout for Greenbrier. Gray had five kills and Hollis Redden 14 assists. The Lady Panthers qualified for the 5A state tournament at Valley View and will play Beebe at 4 p.m. Tuesday.
